body_html:
I was using tensor2tensor 1.1.9 on top of tensorflow 1.3.0rc1, and then I upgraded tensor2tensor to 1.2.0 because of a new change I wanted to adopt. However tensor2tensor 1.2.0 installation uninstalled the existing tensorflow and upgraded it to 1.3.0 also. Now tensorflow can't run with the error message

ImportError: libcudnn.so.6: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

while I have libcudnn.so.5.1.10 only. Does upgrading cudnn fix the problem? Or should I create a symln pointing to the existing cudnn?

However tensor2tensor 1.2.0 installation uninstalled the existing tensorflow and upgraded it to 1.3.0 also. Now tensorflow can't run with the error message

while I have libcudnn.so.5.1.10 only. Does upgrading cudnn fix the problem? Or should I create a symln pointing to the existing cudnn?
body:
I was using tensor2tensor 1.1.9 on top of tensorflow 1.3.0rc1, and then I upgraded tensor2tensor to 1.2.0 because of a new change I wanted to adopt. However tensor2tensor 1.2.0 installation uninstalled the existing tensorflow and upgraded it to 1.3.0 also. Now tensorflow can't run with the error message

> ImportError: libcudnn.so.6: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory 

while I have libcudnn.so.5.1.10 only. Does upgrading cudnn fix the problem? Or should I create a symln pointing to the existing cudnn?
